intro: Daucus prutenicus, commonly known as the Pruteni caraway, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, carroty scent. Daucus prutenicus is often found in dry meadows and rocky soils, and it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
